intro: Amaryllis belladonna baptisa-alba, commonly known as the white belladonna amaryllis, is a striking plant native to South Africa. It features large, showy white flowers with a subtle pinkish tinge, blooming in late winter to early spring. The plant has strap-like, dark green leaves that are narrow and elongated. It thrives in well-drained soil and requires bright, indirect light for optimal growth. This species is prized for its elegant appearance and is often cultivated as a decorative indoor plant.
